text:
*solved: stupidity found.*
HS’s preprocessor is claiming that  `  {% if request.query_dict.job_code %}`  statement isn’t closed, someone mind checking my stupidity, I don’t see a typo, looks closed to me….
ahhh found it there was a quote in my filter variable that didn’t need to be there… oy

Tell me, wise ones.  I am still young to the HubSpot world so pardon my ignorance, but is it possible to create a selects options from a blog post variable?  I have a page design in front of me for a careers page.  at the bottom, there is a form that has a select titled “select position”  the jobs are set up as blog posts.
would it be a good idea to pull all the job titles into the page then fill the select options using jquery?

if I understand correctly you want to have a HubSpot form which has a select input where all of the options are generated by looping through blog posts?
You can’t directly do it.

You might be able to do this though: have the select field outside of the HS form. generate the select field html(by looping through the blog using HubL to create the Option elements).

In the HS form  have an empty text field, use css to hide that field.

use javascript to on change of the select field, set the hidden text field’s value
yeah, that is an interesting approach!
no, because even if it could submit this and not error, your data will show up screwed up because there wouldn’t be any labels to display in HS’s UI
this is why i pay you the big bucks
think you’ve been sending the check to the wrong address lol
ha!
_But if you ever wanted to send some $ my way_ lol, we eventually plan to add a tip jar like feature to the HubSpot <#CBBAW6Z3R|community-browser-extension> :stuck_out_tongue_winking_eye:
i anticipate making a lot in tips
hahah “I’m applying for the HubSpot Developer bartender position”
i am just a dishwasher now, but just you wait!  bar back is just around the corner
so i built this out and it fills the input on the front end, but does not submit it
anything missing?
i’m looking at you <@U7SL518D6>
You may actually have to set the text input on submit using the js callback.
woah
And youre sure the text input field is getting the value? Option:selected would pull all selected options from all select fields on your page
only one select field on the page
i kept the text input visible so i could make sure it was filled
and it was
Ohhhh thats right

When you set the value of a hs form field you have to do keyUp on the field or something. Basically the form uses react and when you fill the data into the field with jquery it doesnt actually set the value of the field until you do that
Not at my computer but its in the docs look for forms
just noticed that
looked at the inspector and the value was not set
Basically using keyup or focus cant remember what function it is, makes it think the user just entered it causing it to store it
no go :disappointed:
